verses.text: Now it came to pass in the days when the judges ruled , that there was a famine in the land. And a certain man of Beth-lehem-judah went to sojourn in the country of Moab , he, and his wife , and his two sons.\f + \fr 1.1 \ft ruled: Heb. judged\f*

And the name of the man \add was\add* Elimelech , and the name of his wife Naomi , and the name of his two sons Mahlon and Chilion , Ephrathites of Beth-lehem-judah. And they came into the country of Moab , and continued there.\f + \fr 1.2 \ft continued: Heb. were\f*
And Elimelech Naomi’s husband died ; and she was left , and her two sons.
And they took them wives of the women of Moab ; the name of the one \add was\add* Orpah , and the name of the other Ruth : and they dwelled there about ten years.
And Mahlon and Chilion died also both of them; and the woman was left of her two sons and her husband. \p

¶ Then she arose with her daughters in law , that she might return from the country of Moab : for she had heard in the country of Moab how that the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* had visited his people in giving them bread.
Wherefore she went forth out of the place where she was, and her two daughters in law with her; and they went on the way to return unto the land of Judah.
And Naomi said unto her two daughters in law , Go , return each to her mother’s house : the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* deal kindly with you, as ye have dealt with the dead , and with me.
The \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* grant you that ye may find rest , each \add of you\add* in the house of her husband. Then she kissed them; and they lifted up their voice , and wept.
And they said unto her, Surely we will return with thee unto thy people.
And Naomi said , Turn again , my daughters : why will ye go with me? \add are\add* there yet \add any more\add* sons in my womb , that they may be your husbands ?

Turn again , my daughters , go \add your way;\add* for I am too old to have an husband. If I should say , I have hope , \add if\add* I should have an husband also to night , and should also bear sons ;\f + \fr 1.12 \ft should have…: or were with an husband\f*

Would ye tarry for them till they were grown ? would ye stay for them from having husbands ? nay, my daughters ; for it grieveth me much for your sakes that the hand of the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* is gone out against me.\f + \fr 1.13 \ft tarry: Heb. hope\f*\f + \fr 1.13 \ft it grieveth…: Heb. I have much bitterness\f*
And they lifted up their voice , and wept again : and Orpah kissed her mother in law ; but Ruth clave unto her.
And she said , Behold, thy sister in law is gone back unto her people , and unto her gods : return thou after thy sister in law.

And Ruth said , Intreat me not to leave thee, \add or\add* to return from following after thee: for whither thou goest , I will go ; and where thou lodgest , I will lodge : thy people \add shall be\add* my people , and thy God my God :\f + \fr 1.16 \ft Intreat…: or, Be not against me\f*
Where thou diest , will I die , and there will I be buried : the \nd \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*\nd* do so to me, and more also, \add if ought\add* but death part thee and me.
When she saw that she was stedfastly minded to go with her, then she left speaking unto her.\f + \fr 1.18 \ft was…: Heb. strengthened herself\f* \p
¶ So they two went until they came to Beth-lehem. And it came to pass, when they were come to Beth-lehem , that all the city was moved about them, and they said , \add Is\add* this Naomi ?
And she said unto them, Call me not Naomi , call me Mara : for the Almighty hath dealt very bitterly with me.\f + \fr 1.20 \ft Naomi: that is, Pleasant\f*\f + \fr 1.20 \ft Mara: that is, Bitter\f*

I went out full , and the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath brought me home again empty : why \add then\add* call ye me Naomi , seeing the 
d \+w LORD|strong="H3068"\+w*
d* hath testified against me, and the Almighty hath afflicted me?
So Naomi returned , and Ruth the Moabitess , her daughter in law , with her, which returned out of the country of Moab : and they came to Beth-lehem in the beginning of barley harvest.
